intro: Aeschynomene youngii, commonly known as the slender goatherb, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions of Africa. It is a member of the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its slender, creeping stems and small, trifoliate leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-white flowers that are clustered in spikes, followed by narrow, pod-like fruits. It is often found in disturbed soils and is used in traditional medicine for its purported healing properties.
